hackathon-rules:
- All hacks must be submitted to DevPost by 9:30am on Sunday, January 22 in order to be judged.
- You may not build off of exisiting projects or write project specific code prior to the event. Use of 3rd party APIs and libraries is allowed.
- The decision of judges is final for determining prizes and awards.
- You must comply with all instructions from BoilerMake organizers.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Choice of Oculus, Apple Watch Series 2, Google Home, or Amazon Echo Dot
Scholarship to winning team members to attend Make School's DC Summer Academy
Rare and Classic Lego Sets (Simpsons House, Millennium Falcon, Ferrari F40, and one more of choice if team of 4)
Syma X5SW Quadcopter w/ camera for Team

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best hack that improves the shopping experience using open source data. Hosted by 84.51

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment. Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Win HackHarassment Swag Bag.
$250 in AWS Credit for Each Team Member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS
Best Smart Home Hack from Qualcomm
Best use of Capital One API

hackathon-description-header: Purdue University - January 20th-22nd - $10,000 in prizes, 500 hackers, 36 hours, 10+ sponsors, 1 room
